lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process can be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features may then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLots identifier is given, the values ought to be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Details about the whole tender can be overridden for a given lot through their inclusion in the lot object.

lotDetails.title: Lot Details
lotDetails.description: Details of any criteria that apply to bidding on the lots in this tender.

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier can bid on as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that can be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this document relates.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: The identifier of the lot to which this item relates.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this milestone relates.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this award relates.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this amendment relates.

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLots references at the item, document and award level.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement planning system.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot.

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated value of this lot.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The estimated minimum value of the lot. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when this lot is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for bid submissions.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or specified to be active. If the lot does not specify explicit dates, the duration field can be used.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The organization aiming to conclude a contract with a supplier or to use the goods, works or services in this lot. This may be different from the procuring entity who may be specified in the tender data.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications
additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for this lot.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Main procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the main object of this lot, from the closed [procurementCategory](https://standard.open-contracting.org/{{version}}/{{lang}}/schema/codelists/#procurement-category) codelist.

additionalProcurementCategories.title: Additional procurement categories
additionalProcurementCategories.description: Any additional categories describing the objects of this lot, using the open [extendedProcurementCategory](https://standard.open-contracting.org/{{version}}/{{lang}}/schema/codelists/#extended-procurement-category) codelist.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification about this lot to the buyer or the procuring entity. Details of how to submit enquiries should be provided in attached notices, or in submissionMethodDetails. Structured dates for when responses to questions will be made can be provided using milestones.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with this lot.

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Information about the methods by which bids are submitted for this lot. This can include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids are submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions. More structured information can be provided using the submission terms extension.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot group. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot group, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement planning system.

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for this lot group.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot group.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots can appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated value of the lots in this group. This can be lower than the sum total of lot values

SimpleIdentifier.title: Simple identifier
SimpleIdentifier.description: An unambiguous reference to a resource within a given context.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list, register or system from which the identifier is taken.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier taken from the scheme.
